results.title: First principles and reflection
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Light”.
Demonstrates how light is invisible and how light travels in straight lines. Beams of light are used to show the formation of shadows, both umbra and penumbra. Solar and lunar eclipses are illustrated by diagrams and actual photographs. Explains the laws of reflection at a plan surface, the equality of angles of incidence and reflection being compared with the movement of a billiard ball. Practical examples are used to illustrate the formation of images in plane mirrors and the lateral inversion of these.

results.title: Examination of a Patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
The procedure for a full head to toe examination of a patient. Utilising a common accident scene the program shows the steps required in handling an unconscious patient before medical help arrives.
results.description:

results.title: Basic Life Support
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Highlights the importance of a commonsense approach to emergency situations. After covering the life threatening priorities of airway, breathing and circulation, the program goes on to explain in detail history (what happened), signs (what you see or feel) and symptoms (what the patient feels). An accident scene highlights this approach and stresses the need for urgent action.

results.title: Bleeding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Using an example of a simulated wound the signs and symptoms of bleeding are explained. Also explained is the natural body control of bleeding including vaso-constriction, fall in blood pressure and the formation of blood clots. Demonstrates bandaging with object in and out of wound.

results.title: Poisons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
What is a poison? How can it enter the body? The importance of identification of the poison. Emergency treatment. Also examines the treatment for bites.

results.title: Broken Bones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Function of bones. How bones can be broken. The signs and symptoms of broken bones and the emergency treatment required. Using an example of a broken bone caused by a direct force the necessary first aid steps are highlighted.

results.title: Occupational First Aid
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Occupational First Aid is the emergency treatment for accidents or illnesses which occur in the workplace. This program looks at the skills required to be a First Aider and at the content and location of First Aid kits in the workplace. First Aiders must be multi-skilled persons able to provide emergency treatment, make decisions regarding treatment or refer, dress and re-dress minor injuries, maintain and stock First Aid kits, actively participate in Safety programs and be familiar with the workplace.

results.title: Shock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Utilising a number of scenario accident sequences, this program highlights the common factor to all injuries - Shock. Defines shock and examines actual and relative fluid loss. Looks at signs and symptoms and explains emergency treatment. Emphasises that shock is an ongoing process which must be treated and stopped.

results.title: Altered consciousness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Examines and defines the altered consciousness state and the problems it causes, in particular, the patient being unable to recognise and thus react to dangers either external e.g. fire, or internal e.g. blocked airway. Looks at Epilepsy, diabetes and head injuries as specific examples. Emergency treatment included . WARNING-The Epilepsy Foundation of Victoria has advised that this program contains outdated information and shows practices no longer followed.
